<!-- source-hash: d4d6b19319d16d1ca528497eb1f8a99a -->
A custom runtime exception thrown when an organization lookup fails to find a matching organization by ID.

## Key Components

- **OrganizationNotFoundException** - Runtime exception class that extends `RuntimeException`
- **Constructor** - Takes an `organizationId` string parameter and formats a descriptive error message

## Usage Example

```java
// In a service class
public Organization findOrganization(String orgId) {
    Organization org = organizationRepository.findById(orgId);
    if (org == null) {
        throw new OrganizationNotFoundException(orgId);
    }
    return org;
}

// Exception handling
try {
    Organization org = organizationService.findOrganization("invalid-id");
} catch (OrganizationNotFoundException e) {
    logger.error("Failed to find organization: " + e.getMessage());
    // Handle the missing organization scenario
}
```

This exception provides clear error messaging that includes the specific organization ID that wasn't found, making debugging easier for developers.
